pr_title: Display accurate replay durations in vault

timeline.message: Add replay time to replay details
Use replay tick duration on cards if available
Add tooltips to replay detail labels

timeline.bodyText: just for my information, where is that object property used?
timeline.author: norraxx

replies.bodyText: I didn't use it anywhere. I just included it because the other attributes seemed to have them. IDK what an ObjectProperty even does.
replies.author: Askaholic

replies.bodyText: it is an object where u can listen for changes
replies.author: 1-alex98

replies.bodyText: It's an observable object, following the observer pattern from software engineering. You can add a listener that gets notified on changes. The property, which is introduced by javafc id a special implementation of this observer pattern allowing properties to be bound to others (supporting converters) therefore updating each other/ UI components when changed.
replies.author: Geosearchef

timeline.author: norraxx

replies.bodyText: Yes but there are 10 ticks per second. So 10/s * 100 = 1000/s
replies.author: Askaholic

replies.bodyText: Oh! Math hidden!! :-) how about to show it as constant with explanation? Otherwise it's not visible on first sight
replies.author: norraxx

timeline.author: norraxx

timeline.message: Make icon be a timer with play symbol in the center
Add test for checking that replayDurationLabel is set

timeline.bodyText: Maybe we should use the unicode format ala \u0055??
timeline.author: norraxx

replies.bodyText: That's normally what I would do, but it's like this in the rest of the code so I was just trying to keep it consistent.
replies.author: Askaholic
